question.title: Question
question.description: Where is a typical tophus most likely to be clinically detectable in a patient with microcrystalline arthropathy?

option_a.title: Option A
option_a.description: On the palm of the hand

option_c.title: Option C
option_c.description: On the helix of the ear

option_d.title: Option D
option_d.description: On the finger pad, toe, or foot
